Jesus does not excuse their sins, but shows their penitence and faith, and, claiming for them forgiveness, he lifts his wounded hands before the Father and the holy angels, saying, \93I know them by name. I have graven them on the palms of my hands. \91The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.\94 [Psalm 51:17.] And to the accuser of his people he declares, \93The Lord rebuke thee, O Satan; even the Lord that hath chosen Jerusalem rebuke thee. Is not this a brand plucked out of the fire?\92 [Zechariah 3:2.] Christ will clothe his faithful ones with his own righteousness, that he may present them to his Father \93a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing.\94 [Ephesians 5:27.] Their names stand enrolled in the book 
485
of life, and concerning them it is written, \93They shall walk with me in white; for they are worthy.\94 [Revelation 3:4.]
